Reviews.Title: “Good for the money.”
Reviews.Author: 00kimba
Reviews.Content: Good location near some great restraunts and also I-240. Spacious rooms w/full kitchens. Employees very nice. Hot breakfsat included in price. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: gopcs
Reviews.Content: This is the worst Residence Inn. It is in desperate need of a full remodel. Furniture very worn, burnt spot on vinyl floor in kitchen. Main television is 19" CRT model.

Reviews.Title: “Not home, but not all that bad”
Reviews.Author: Sophie55197
Reviews.Content: My family is in a long-term stay at this Residence Inn due to a house fire, so I have a different perspective than a tourist staying overnight. After seeing so many negative reviews, I have few positive things to say about this hotel. 1. The Residence Inn accepts pets which means our pet can stay with us while our house is being repaired and not boarded at a kennel indefinitely. 2. The rooms are very clean, although the furniture is admittedly a bit worn. 3. The staff here are very friendly and accommodating. 4. Breakfast is quite nice and the selections rotate on a regular basis. The scrambled eggs are especially delicious. 5. The Wednesday night reception features chicken and burgers grilled on an actual grill. Nice touch. 6. The pool is very clean and well-maintained. The only thing I wish for, other than being able to move back home, is newer televisions and in-room wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Run run, as fast as you can, You can't stay here unless you like cold showers, pet urine, moldy walls...”
Reviews.Author: cessalee
Reviews.Content: It doesn't take too much to impress me. And the staff here did. Thank goodness for them! But sometimes that's not enough to save a property. This is, by far, the WORST Residence Inn in which I have ever stayed. As a matter of fact, the worst Marriott I've been in. First of all, I called two days early to make sure my reservation was correct and my Rewards number was on file, and to make sure I had a low floor room (I like to do yoga and Insanity in the mornings and try to be considerate). Upon arrival, neither had been added. As a matter of fact, they only had two rooms available for our group of three. Attempting to be chivalrous, I offered to run some errands while they prepared the final room. When I came back, they tried to offer me a room with no windows to the outside. With the lighting being so dim, that was not a good option for me so I was told the only other room had just been painted and I could go see if I could deal with the paint smell (opening windows was not an option, they have solid double paned glass). Upon checking it out, I didn't notice paint..it actually smelled more like they had recently freshened up the room. About an hour later I figured out why. There is dog urine EVERYWHERE!!! Unfortunately during that hour, I had unpacked all my things (we're staying here 18 nights so I have a lot of stuff) so I decided to just deal with it, buy some febreeze and get over it. I called the front desk and asked them to spray the carpets and told them to take their time, I wasn't staying in the room the first night anyway. So I came back the next morning and because of daylight savings time thought I'd call and see if just maybe the breakfast hours had been extended and only when I called was I informed that "Oh yeah, we're gonna have to move you from that room." Huhhh....sigh....I'm annoyed at this point because I wish they told me that when I originally called about the urine. SURELY they knew that, if, indeed the room had been painted, it was because of animal issues. Instead of hiding the problem, they just made it my problem. So I get over it, pack up my things, get ready to jump in the shower, and to top it all off, there's no hot water. That's the major issue, there are the other things like none of the furniture matches, the kitchen hasn't been remodeled since probably the early 90s, the dresser drawer has two options, 2 inches open or falling on your feet, there's mold from water damage in the closet, there was an empty 6 pack container in the refrigerator when I got my room, you can hear EVERYTHING from the units above and beside me, oh and did I mention the train that runs by my window for at least 4 minutes at a time all day (and night). Overall, I'm sure I could have stopped a few paragraphs ago, but please for your sanity, money, and nose hairs...don't stay here. And just to finish on a positive note, the staff here is REALLY nice. They just are trying to make people happy, and it's unfortunate that this is all they have to work with.

Reviews.Title: “One of my worst stays at a Residence Inn”
Reviews.Author: gabigoose
Reviews.Content: I frequently stay 100+ nights a year at Marriott properties. Sadly, this hotel may be the worst Residence Inn among the many I've tried. Rooms are really worn and tired. Renovations that have been done are on the extremely cheap side...just sloppy execution overall. The hotel feels like a Super 8 from the 1980's. The furniture belongs in a Goodwill store. Some front desk staff members seemed very polite and welcoming, but the breakfast staff just seemed annoyed with life.

Reviews.Title: “What you don't know can spoil your stay”
Reviews.Author: SKS56
Reviews.Content: Spent the night with our two older teenagers while in Memphis to see Wicked. Residence Inn is one of the few chains with a 2 bedroom apartment. Who would think to ask if there are doors on the bedrooms? There aren't. Apparently removed in some prior renovation. That's the whole point of a 2 BR apartment, to get some privacy and avoid waking others when I left for the airport early in the morning. And who would think to ask if there is a railroad track at the back of the hotel? There is. And the trains came through and woke my wife three times during the night. The Staff was friendly, and Michael at the front desk was helpful in providing directions, but be sure you know what you're getting.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: still-call-oz-home
Reviews.Content: Even if you're just passing through, there's nothing close by. There's a couple of fast food restaurants close but if you're hungry after a long days driving you'll have to drive somewhere for a decent meal.

Reviews.Title: “Glad it was a free room”
Reviews.Author: 1tiredpuppy
Reviews.Content: We booked this room on line for 4 adults for one night with a free voucher. When we got to the hotel, the front desk person saw all of us, but put us in a room with one double bed. When we called down to the front desk, we were informed that this room was all they had. We asked if there was sleeper sofa and all they kept saying was "this is all we have'. The room did have double sleeper sofa, but no pillows for it, just the linens. There is no door between the bedroom and the living room and the one 21" TV was in the living room and the remote wouldn't work. The furniture was very worn and dirty and the bed was very uncomfortable. The workout room was being re-done, but we did get to use the pool. There were no towels, as stated in the book in our room and we had to chase down a housekeeper to get towels. Half the time we were at the pool we got to listen to one of the hotel employees complain non-stop with another employee about his job as they stood around talking. Here's a hint - GO FIND ANOTHER JOB! The hotel sits right by the train tracks and the train blows it's horn every time it comes by, made for a long night. The worst part of the whole stay was the breakfast. They had at least 2 attendants working and neither one of them cleaned off a table. There was trash and food everywhere. The eggs were cold, the potatoes were greasy and the bagels were stale. Glad I won't ever have to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Below Standards”
Reviews.Author: texaswillie
Reviews.Content: This is a rather old hotel and you can immediately tell this upon parking and entering your room. We have stayed at Marriott properties all over the world and this hotel is definitely not what one expects at a Resdence Inn. Service at the front desk was very good. The parking lot at the back of the hotel was not the cleanest. Upon entering the hotel one can easily tell that this is a rather old property. The room we had was on the first floor. There are several seperate buildings and we were in the main building. The room needed a lot of TLC. The carpet was pulled from the wall on one side of the room leaving a one inch gap between the carpet and wall. There was a one inch crack at the bottom of the door thus we heard hall way noises throughout the stay. There had been poor quality repairs made in the bathroom on the tiles. Looked like a real amature had done it. The chair and couch had dirty arm covers. There was one very old 21 inch TV set in the living room area. While there was a hook up in the bedroom there was no TV set. We noticed on the ceiling that part of the molding was missing. Equipment in the kitchen area was old and not all that clean. We opted not to use any of it. We arrived around 8:30AM for breakfast and the food left a lot to be desired. Not only that, the person in charge started turing lights out at 8:55AM (there was a 9AM closing time). Eggs were cold, burned and crispy. Sausage had not be cooked. There was one banana, no yogert, skimmpy pastries and in general this was not a very appealing place to eat. One young couple came in, looked around and decided to leave without eating. There was a mop bucket sitting at the end of the food area. Not very appealing. Coffee had a distinct "metal taste" to it. We decided to pass and go to Starbucks. Now I have a confession----while I always review TripAdvisor, this is one of the very few times I failed to do so. I could have saved us a lot of concerns had I just reviewed what other travelers had encountered.

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: traveler2009_4u
Reviews.Content: The room was large with a separate bedroom (but no door) Room had paint missing and was hard to regulate the temperature (either sweat or freeze - no middle) Staff was very friendly. Bed was horrible and the train flying through with the horn blowing forever (I had a room in the back) was annoying. The business center was one computer in the lobby - that was always in use by the tons of kids there. Just an ok hotel

Reviews.Title: “Okay place to stay in Memphis”
Reviews.Author: cyndeeM
Reviews.Content: This Residence in is pretty nice. It appears to not yet been completly updated as others I have stayed in but it suited my purposes. I was staying in Memphis on a weeklong business trip at an office park near by and the hotel made it very easy to commute. First if you have a problem with NOISE don't stay at this hotel. There are trains that run by several times during both day and night. They do warn youf this at the front desk. I don't have a problem with train noise so that wasn't an issue with my stay. All in all my stay was average no major issues. The staff as in most Marriott properties was very friendly and helpful. I will probably stay here again if in Memphis on business

Reviews.Title: “Beyond the excellence”
Reviews.Author: RajibIndia
Reviews.Content: Staying in Marriott at US was a pleasant experience for 29 days. It was excellent accomodation and defined by it's owned cosyness and individuality. Service in all the aspects was beyond the satisfactory level. I always remember Marriott when I remember US.

Reviews.Title: “not that bad”
Reviews.Author: tjh780
Reviews.Content: WE were able to stay for under $100. Our room was huge and clean. We were there on the weekend and had to leave early. The breafast was late opening,so we left with out it. We were on the RR side of the building, heard the train once during the night. Decent location for travelling around Memphis.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: DittybopperAKN
Reviews.Content: I have read other very negative reviews of this hotel, but we saw none of the problems those people had. We were with a group of US Air Force veterans of the Korean War era--a reunion of about a dozen people--and the hotel staff was superb, giving us a special deal on rates (probably almost half what others would pay per night). This building was built in 1985, but updated in 2004, so it's modern in all ways. The hotel staff allowed us a general meeting room in which to gather at any time, the rooms were clean, and there is a hot breakfast buffet which was very good. There is the problem of some trains on the tracks behind the building, but their slight noise was tolerable. Overall, we all were very happy with our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very, Very Bad”
Reviews.Author: jrlockport
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, the lobby looked nice and the staff were very pleasant. I new I had a problem when the gentleman asked if I wanted to be in the front or the back but the back is where the train runs through. I chose the front. When I got to the door of my room (which was filthy) I opened it and this odor came from inside the room, I new right then I was not staying at this hotel. To start there was literally mold around the top edging of the tub, the burners to the stove were not on the stove and again, the smell was so bad we had to leave the door open until I could get ahold of the front desk and let them know that we would not be spending the evening. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a clean place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Really not that bad”
Reviews.Author: travellingtuba
Reviews.Content: I stay at a lot of Marriotts for the points, so I've been to quite a few Residence Inns. This place is really not as bad as some of the reviews say. If you're looking for the amenities of a Residence Inn, this place has them: free (good) breakfast, full kitchens in the rooms, exercise room, pool, business services, nightly dinners. I stayed in the "penthouse" suite with my husband and parents, and there was a main floor and a loft with second bedroom and bathroom. Downfalls: 1.) Kind of dirty and unkempt-looking. The windows weren't particularly clean, and it looked as if they were doing electrical work on the ceilings because some of the tiles were missing in the hallways. It looked as if someone with greasy hands had fixed things on the walls but hadn't cleaned up afterwards. The beds and bathrooms were clean, though. 2.) So-so staff. There didn't seem to be many of them around. 3.) Weird emergency exit. From the 2nd floor loft, there was a big door that said "Emergency Exit, Do not open" that locked from the inside, so, naturally, we opened it (it was not alarmed). It opened out on to part of the roof where all the electrical machinery and generators were. There was a weird plank walkway, and nothing was fenced/blocked off. If I had little kids that could open doors, I would be VERY nervous to have them up there unattended for fear that they would go out there and fall off the roof or god only knows what. It was just a little unsettling and odd. Conclusion, I would stay here again, if just passing through town (which we were), also if I got a good deal (we had used points to pay for the whole room, so it was essentially free). However, if I were to stay in this area for an extended trip, there was a Courtyard and Staybridge Suites nearby that I may have chosen instead.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here!”
Reviews.Author: washaw
Reviews.Content: Do NOT stay here. Everything was wrong: drawer missing from dresser, bath vanity broken, door lock damaged, no toilet paper, high noise of trains right next to room, hostile staff. I stay often with Marriott and they should not have their name on this place. It is a dump. Do NOT stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very loud & run down (right next to RR tracks!)”
Reviews.Author: Freyja303
Reviews.Content: I was in Memphis for a conference and my coworkers and I selected this hotel based on the good reputation of the Marriott chain. BIG mistake. This is a bad hotel in a NOISY location. I actually checked out after the first night and spent the second night at the Staybridge Suites- which was just down the road (less than 1 mile away) and a thousand times nicer. The Residence Inn is literally 100 feet (at most) from a busy train track and not too far from a street where the trains cross and blow their whistles. Trains came on a regular basis all day and all night long with a hour at most between trains. It was EXTREMELY loud and I got more or less no sleep. I am a 20-something that lived in dorms/apartments not too long ago, and currently live in an urban area, close to a fire station--so am used to noise and am certainly not what would be considered a "light sleeper". I do not see how anyone can sleep through the freight trains going by this hotel!! My room was on the back of the hotel facing the train tracks - however, my coworker stayed in a room on the front of the hotel and he said he could hear the trains loud and clear from his room as well. My room was so close to the tracks it actually shook as the freight trains went roaring by all night long. My room (in the main building) was also dingy and run down. The coffee machine had not been cleaned and had mold growing inside. The closet door and towel bar were broken - closet door actually fell off when I tried to open. Room was missing an iron. The light in the bathroom had burned out. The room could have been cleaned better too (hair on bathroom floor, etc. etc.). On the positive side, the staff was very friendly, kind and most apologetic about the train situation. There is really no fault to be place on the staff for the awful location of this hotel and my bad experience staying here. Also, positively speaking, were the warm chocolate chip cookies served at check-in and the free breakfast (which I thought had a good selection). If you absolutely must stay at this hotel, I would suggest you be REALLY tired when you arrive, to the point where nothing would wake you - or bring a pair of earplugs. The Marriott chain should seriously consider removing their affiliation from this particular property. I cannot imagine there are any repeat customers. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: Mallory8705
Reviews.Content: We moved to this hotel from one that was absolutly awful. We stayed in a studio suite which was newly redone, it was incredibly nice for what we paid 109$ per night we stayed two nights dec 30 and the 31 on the 31 we had some problems with a party going on above us; however it was taken care of very promtly and with a great attitude. We were unfamilar with the area and the lady at the front desk was more then happy to print off directions for us. We travel with our small dog and there was a 100$ fee for him but he is more then worth it, the room felt like home with a kitchen and living room. It was all very nice for the price, the only complaint I can think of it there is a train track very close.

Reviews.Title: “Not for my vacation!”
Reviews.Author: composthappens
Reviews.Content: We were booked to stay here April 20 and 21. As we were traveling with my in-laws, we specifically requested a 2 bedroom, 2 bath unit. When we checked in, our room consisted of 1 bedroom with a large opening but no door to block it from the living room, and a second bed located in an upstairs loft with just a partial wall. No way was this what we were told on the phone! As others have mentioned, this place backs right up to the train tracks and is also located near a hospital. So if you like ambulances and trains, go for it! We checked out and stayed at the Days Inn Graceland.

Reviews.Title: “Not in the best shape”
Reviews.Author: Thetripcolony
Reviews.Content: We had a nice penthouse room, well layed out close to the lobby. Very good breakfast bar and area to eat. The hotel has some drawbacks though. Our room showed signs of wear it needs to have the carpets and curtians replaced we also had a few bugs in the bathrooms. The trains go by about every hour and shake the whole property and the parking lot is too small if you arrive late you'll have a very hard time finding a place to park.

Reviews.Title: “The Company Should Be Ashamed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I really don't think I've ever stayed in such a terrible hotel in the United States and I have certainly never given a hotel a terrible grade. We checked into one of their penthouse suites after a long drive with our small children. After putting them immediately to bed, I discovered how dirty the room was and was shocked. The sliding glass doors looked like they had never been clean. There were stains on the walls and ceilings, mold on the air conditioner intake filter and there was hair all over the floor in the upstairs bathroom. Upon further inspection, I realized it was pet hair. Now, we've stayed at many Residence Inns in our lifetime and most take pets, but I have never seen pet hair on the floor. The downstairs tub/shower was dirty and when I mentioned it to my husband, he told me to be glad that I hadn't used the upstairs shower. He said there was mold/mildew all around the top of the shower. The hotel looks like it was converted from an old apartment building and while some of these issues are just general maintenance issues, most of the problems could be remedied by a good housekeeping staff. We would have checked out if our kids hadn't already been asleep. When I mentioned it to the front desk clerk upon checking out, she seemed surprised but not that apologetic. I really don't think they care. If they did, the hotel wouldn't be in the shape it is. I can't believe we paid over $150 to stay in such a filthy hotel. Residence Inn should seriously reconsider having their name on this property.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Alabama_Traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awful. We stayed in the penthouse suite for two nights and what a rip off. The carpet was nasty, our toilet over flowed the first night, carpet was dirty so we had to keep shoes on. There was a floor board loose on the floor upstairs. Also the decor was old. We were very upset.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stay was just okay... room config as small bedroom with decent size living room/kitchen area (l shaped). A little dated interior with the exterior entrance...a problem of a rainy day when we arrived. Kitchen had very few plates/utensils. Bfast was not very good.. limited selection,burned bacon, hard eggs and staff hurried/unfriendly trying to replinish.. plus staff started cleaning up 20 mins before the mealtime was up... you just got the feeling that they didn't want you at Bfast at the published closing time...go early. Outdoor pool only. There was a hotel across the lot that looked newer

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay at again!”
Reviews.Author: BayAreaTraveler41
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights at $119/night. Had problems from the start. High-speed internet access did not work. I called front desk, they sent up the janitor who blamed my laptop. I'm a network engineer, my laptop is fine and worked at every hotel I stayed at during this road trip. They sent up another guy the next day but the issue was never resolved so I used dial-up. Not a big deal but I chose this hotel over others because it had high-speed internet which I need for my job. The sofa in the room was filthy and really needed a cleaning. The carpet was very dirty too. I took my shoes off and walked around room. Later looked at my socks and they were brown from the dirt they picked up off the carpet. Second day, the soap and shampoo was not replaced. I had to call down for more. Had to call down on the third day for a roll of toilet paper. Not sure why this hotel is trying to save a few pennies by not supplying an extra roll of TP and shampoo. Also, no lotion or conditioner supplied at all. The shower was never cleaned during my stay. Don't plan on the breakfast buffet to fill you up. Was just mushy canned fruit and stale bagels. Though the coffee was good. I'm not usually displeased with hotel service, but I was at this location. I probably would have got better service and a cleaner room at Motel 6.

HotelInfo.Name: Residence Inn Memphis East
HotelInfo.Address: 6141 Old Poplar Pike, Memphis, TN 38119
